articles.title: Trilobites: A Volcanic Eruption on Mars? Nope.

articles.content: Arsia Mons is 12 miles high and 270 miles wide, dwarfing Mauna Loa, Earths largest volcano, which is only 6.3 miles high and 75 miles wide, and mostly underwater. (Its not the biggest volcano on Mars, though. Thats Olympus Mons, which is more than 13 miles ta… [+790 chars]

articles.title: NASA's First Image of Mars from a CubeSat
articles.description: NASA's MarCO mission was designed to find out if briefcase-sized spacecraft called CubeSats could survive the journey to deep space. Now, MarCO—which stands for Mars Cube One—has Mars in sight.
articles.content: One of NASA's twin MarCO spacecraft took this image of Mars on October 2the first time a CubeSat, a kind of low-cost, briefcase-sized spacecrafthas done so. Credit: NASA/JPL-Caltech NASA's MarCO mission was designed to find out if briefcase-sized spacecraft c… [+2370 chars]

articles.title: Tiny Lakes Once Pooled on Ancient Mars, Only to Fade Away
articles.description: Before Mars became a forbiddingly dry world, water once came and went smoothly on the planet's surface, just as it does here on Earth. Now, scientists have identified the traces of three different sets of these ancient lakes.
